comments:
build I20071030-0010

I had an OSGi launch configuration (from a while ago) that was set up to run with a foundation 1.0 VM. When I try and launch it, I get the following NPE. If I switch the VM to be the default (1.4.2) then all works ok.

!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.jobs 4 2 2007-10-31 13:13:52.572
!MESSAGE An internal error occurred during: "Launching ProvAdminUI".
!STACK 0
java.lang.NullPointerException
        at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.launching.StandardVMDebugger.getJavaVersion(StandardVMDebugger.java:441)
        at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.launching.StandardVMDebugger.run(StandardVMDebugger.java:176)
        at org.eclipse.pde.ui.launcher.AbstractPDELaunchConfiguration.launch(AbstractPDELaunchConfiguration.java:94)
        at org.eclipse.pde.ui.launcher.OSGiLaunchConfigurationDelegate.launch(OSGiLaunchConfigurationDelegate.java:48)
        at org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.LaunchConfiguration.launch(LaunchConfiguration.java:757)
        at org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.LaunchConfiguration.launch(LaunchConfiguration.java:607)
        at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.DebugUIPlugin.buildAndLaunch(DebugUIPlugin.java:826)
        at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.DebugUIPlugin$7.run(DebugUIPlugin.java:1029)
        at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:55)
If you defined the JRE a while ago, please try re-creating it from the ee file (delete/add). We added a new JRE type for EE's and I think the JRE you have is an old one.
Yes. I believe this was the problem.
